trans-unit.source: How to: Use ACS Management Service to Configure AD FS 2.0 as an Enterprise Identity Provider
trans-unit.target: How to: Use ACS Management Service to Configure AD FS 2.0 as an Enterprise Identity Provider

trans-unit.source: Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure

trans-unit.source: How to: Use ACS Management Service to Configure AD FS 2.0 as an Enterprise Identity Provider
trans-unit.target: How to: Use ACS Management Service to Configure AD FS 2.0 as an Enterprise Identity Provider

trans-unit.source: Applies To
trans-unit.target: Applies To

trans-unit.source: Microsoft® Azure™ Access Control Service (ACS)
trans-unit.target: Microsoft® Azure™ Access Control Service (ACS)

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Active Directory® Federation Services (AD FS) 2.0
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Active Directory® Federation Services (AD FS) 2.0

trans-unit.source: Summary
trans-unit.target: Summary

trans-unit.source: This topic explains how to add the <token>secondref_adfs2</token> identity provider to a namespace or relying party application.
trans-unit.target: This topic explains how to add the <token>secondref_adfs2</token> identity provider to a namespace or relying party application.

trans-unit.source: To perform this task, you can the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service.
trans-unit.target: To perform this task, you can the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service.

trans-unit.source: The Management Service is particularly useful when you are building a custom user interface for managing <token>secondref_acs</token> and when automating the addition of new tenants for multi-tenant Software as a Service (SaaS) solutions.
trans-unit.target: The Management Service is particularly useful when you are building a custom user interface for managing <token>secondref_acs</token> and when automating the addition of new tenants for multi-tenant Software as a Service (SaaS) solutions.

trans-unit.target: Step 2 – Add References to the Required Services and Assemblies

trans-unit.target: Verify that the configuration is successful.

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: The <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service is a web service that exposes <token>secondref_acs</token> features to code.
trans-unit.target: The <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service is a web service that exposes <token>secondref_acs</token> features to code.

trans-unit.source: The <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service can access all <token>secondref_acs</token> features, including the feature subset that is available in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal user interface.
trans-unit.target: The <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service can access all <token>secondref_acs</token> features, including the feature subset that is available in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal user interface.

trans-unit.source: Adding Microsoft <token>secondref_adfs2</token> as an identity provider to <token>secondref_acs</token> allows you to reuse the investment made in corporate identity management for cloud-based solutions.
trans-unit.target: Adding Microsoft <token>secondref_adfs2</token> as an identity provider to <token>secondref_acs</token> allows you to reuse the investment made in corporate identity management for cloud-based solutions.

trans-unit.source: To configure <token>secondref_adfs2</token> as identity provider, you need to write code that follows specific steps.
trans-unit.target: To configure <token>secondref_adfs2</token> as identity provider, you need to write code that follows specific steps.

trans-unit.source: This topic outlines these basic steps.
trans-unit.target: This topic outlines these basic steps.

trans-unit.source: Summary of Steps
trans-unit.target: Summary of Steps

trans-unit.source: Step 1 – Collect Configuration Information
trans-unit.target: Step 1 – Collect Configuration Information

trans-unit.source: Step 2 – Add References to the Required Services and Assemblies
trans-unit.target: Step 2 – Add References to the Required Services and Assemblies

trans-unit.source: Step 3 – Implement the Management Service Proxy
trans-unit.target: Step 3 – Implement the Management Service Proxy

trans-unit.source: Step 4 – Add an Identity Provider
trans-unit.target: Step 4 – Add an Identity Provider

trans-unit.source: Step 5 – Test Your Work
trans-unit.target: Step 5 – Test Your Work

trans-unit.source: Step 1 – Collect Configuration Information
trans-unit.target: Step 1 – Collect Configuration Information

trans-unit.source: This step explains how to collect the required configuration information.
trans-unit.target: This step explains how to collect the required configuration information.

trans-unit.source: You need to collect the following information:
trans-unit.target: You need to collect the following information:

trans-unit.source: Management Service identity username.
trans-unit.target: Management Service identity username.

trans-unit.source: The default value is <ui>ManagementClient</ui>.
trans-unit.target: The default value is <ui>ManagementClient</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Management Service identity password.
trans-unit.target: Management Service identity password.

trans-unit.source: Namespace name.
trans-unit.target: Namespace name.

trans-unit.source: ACS hostname: accesscontrol.windows.net
trans-unit.target: ACS hostname: accesscontrol.windows.net

trans-unit.source: Signing certificate string: Get the AD FS signing certificate string from your <token>secondref_adfs2</token> deployment.
trans-unit.target: Signing certificate string: Get the AD FS signing certificate string from your <token>secondref_adfs2</token> deployment.

trans-unit.source: To find the Management Service identity username and password, use the following procedure.
trans-unit.target: To find the Management Service identity username and password, use the following procedure.

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Management Service</ui> and then select a management service, such as <ui>ManagementClient</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Management Service</ui> and then select a management service, such as <ui>ManagementClient</ui>.

trans-unit.source: The value of the <ui>Name</ui> field is the <system>Management Service identity username</system>.
trans-unit.target: The value of the <ui>Name</ui> field is the <system>Management Service identity username</system>.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Credentials</ui> section, click <ui>Password</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Credentials</ui> section, click <ui>Password</ui>.

trans-unit.source: The value in the password field is the <embeddedLabel>Management Service identity password</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: The value in the password field is the <embeddedLabel>Management Service identity password</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: After collecting the required information, follow these steps to create a sample console application that will execute the code to add <token>secondref_adfs2</token> as an identity provider:
trans-unit.target: After collecting the required information, follow these steps to create a sample console application that will execute the code to add <token>secondref_adfs2</token> as an identity provider:

trans-unit.source: Start <token>vs_current_short</token> and create a new console application project.
trans-unit.target: Start <token>vs_current_short</token> and create a new console application project.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Program</ui> class, assign the configuration information values to variables with module scope.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Program</ui> class, assign the configuration information values to variables with module scope.

trans-unit.source: The following code sample shows how this might be done.
trans-unit.target: The following code sample shows how this might be done.

trans-unit.source: Step 2 – Add References to the Required Services and Assemblies
trans-unit.target: Step 2 – Add References to the Required Services and Assemblies

trans-unit.source: This step identifies and adds the required dependencies to the services and assemblies.
trans-unit.target: This step identifies and adds the required dependencies to the services and assemblies.

trans-unit.source: To add the required dependencies to the services and assemblies
trans-unit.target: To add the required dependencies to the services and assemblies

trans-unit.source: Add a reference to System.Web.Extensions.
trans-unit.target: Add a reference to System.Web.Extensions.

trans-unit.source: Add a service reference to the Management Service.
trans-unit.target: Add a service reference to the Management Service.

trans-unit.source: The Management Service URL is unique to your namespace and looks similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: The Management Service URL is unique to your namespace and looks similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: https://<placeholder>YOURNAMESPACE</placeholder>.accesscontrol.windows.net/v2/mgmt/service
trans-unit.target: https://<placeholder>YOURNAMESPACE</placeholder>.accesscontrol.windows.net/v2/mgmt/service

trans-unit.source: Add the following declarations.
trans-unit.target: Add the following declarations.

trans-unit.source: Step 3 – Implement the Management Service Proxy
trans-unit.target: Step 3 – Implement the Management Service Proxy

trans-unit.source: This step creates a method that encapsulates the implementation of the Management Service proxy.
trans-unit.target: This step creates a method that encapsulates the implementation of the Management Service proxy.

trans-unit.source: To implement the Management Service proxy
trans-unit.target: To implement the Management Service proxy

trans-unit.source: Add the following method to the <ui>Program</ui> class.
trans-unit.target: Add the following method to the <ui>Program</ui> class.

trans-unit.source: Implement the <ui>GetTokenWithWritePermission</ui> method and its helper methods.
trans-unit.target: Implement the <ui>GetTokenWithWritePermission</ui> method and its helper methods.

trans-unit.source: It will add the SWT OAuth token to the Authorization header of the HTTP request.
trans-unit.target: It will add the SWT OAuth token to the Authorization header of the HTTP request.

trans-unit.source: Step 4 – Add an Identity Provider
trans-unit.target: Step 4 – Add an Identity Provider

trans-unit.source: This step adds <token>secondref_adfs2</token> as an identity provider using the Management Service proxy you created earlier.
trans-unit.target: This step adds <token>secondref_adfs2</token> as an identity provider using the Management Service proxy you created earlier.

trans-unit.source: To add AD FS 2.0 as an identity provider
trans-unit.target: To add AD FS 2.0 as an identity provider

trans-unit.source: Initialize the Management Service proxy.
trans-unit.target: Initialize the Management Service proxy.

trans-unit.source: Add your identity provider as the issuer.
trans-unit.target: Add your identity provider as the issuer.

trans-unit.source: Create an identity provider.
trans-unit.target: Create an identity provider.

trans-unit.source: Create an identity provider signing key based on the certificate you obtained earlier.
trans-unit.target: Create an identity provider signing key based on the certificate you obtained earlier.

trans-unit.source: Update the identity provider sign-in address.
trans-unit.target: Update the identity provider sign-in address.

trans-unit.source: Make the identity provider available to relying parties, except the Management Service.
trans-unit.target: Make the identity provider available to relying parties, except the Management Service.

trans-unit.source: Step 5 – Test Your Work
trans-unit.target: Step 5 – Test Your Work

trans-unit.source: To test your work
trans-unit.target: To test your work

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Access Control Service</ui> page, click the <ui>Rule Groups</ui> link in the <ui>Trust Relationships</ui> section.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Access Control Service</ui> page, click the <ui>Rule Groups</ui> link in the <ui>Trust Relationships</ui> section.

trans-unit.source: Click any of the available rules.
trans-unit.target: Click any of the available rules.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Edit Rule Group</ui> page, click the <ui>Add Rule</ui> link.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Edit Rule Group</ui> page, click the <ui>Add Rule</ui> link.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Add Claim Rule</ui> page, choose the newly added identity provider from the drop-down list in the <ui>Claim Issuer</ui> section.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Add Claim Rule</ui> page, choose the newly added identity provider from the drop-down list in the <ui>Claim Issuer</ui> section.

trans-unit.source: Leave the rest of the default values.
trans-unit.target: Leave the rest of the default values.

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Save</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Save</ui>.

trans-unit.source: You have just created a pass-through rule for the identity provider.
trans-unit.target: You have just created a pass-through rule for the identity provider.
